10870Journal of Chemical CrystallographyJournal of Chemical Crystallography1074-15421572-8854Kluwer Academic Publishers-Plenum PublishersNew YorkArt237271010.1023/A:1015669012264ArticleSynthesis and crystal structure of [Cu2(NO3)4L2(BIPY)2 (H2O)3]·H2O (L = N,N′-bis(4-pyridylmethyl) isophthalamideBuchanSusan1PlaterM. John1ForemanMark R.St.J.1De SilvaBenjamin M.1SkakleJanet M.S.1SlawinAlexandra M.Z.2grid.7107.10000000419367291Department of ChemistryUniversity of AberdeenMeston WalkAB24 3UEAberdeenUnited Kingdomgrid.11914.3c0000000107211626Molecular Structure LaboratoryUniversity of St. AndrewsSt. Andrews, FifeUnited Kingdom22002321-251014102004© Plenum Publishing Corporation 20022002Abstract

The synthesis and molecular structure of the title compound is reported. There are two different Cu atoms in separate chains which are linked to form double-stranded chains. Each Cu has a distorted octahedral coordination geometry. The structure has a triclinic space group P-1 with a = 11.0764(5), b = 15.9276(7), c = 18.2000(7) Å, V = 3197.9(2) Å3, and Z = 2.

Abstract

The synthesis and molecular structure of the title compound is reported. There are two different Cu atoms in separate chains which are linked to form double-stranded chains. Each Cu has a distorted octahedral coordination geometry. The structure has a triclinic space group P-1 with a = 11.0764(5), b = 15.9276(7), c = 18.2000(7) Å, V = 3197.9(2) Å3, and Z = 2.
